title: How did the Red Sox ‘B’ become a symbol of Boston’s identity?

title: Police remove 115 animals from Mass. home, department says
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Local News Officers recovered 115 animals — including chickens, turkeys, geese, quails, ducks, one guinea hen, two dogs, two cats, five rabbits, two ferrets, and five goats — a process that took four hours.
ShareSend this article to your social connections.

More than 100 animals — the majority being farm birds, as well as dogs, rabbits, ferrets, and other animals — were removed from a Plympton home Tuesday as part of an animal cruelty investigation, police said.

title: Body found behind CVS identified as missing Middleborough woman
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News Amy Nadolny, 41, was found in a wooded area along train tracks behind a CVS on Wareham's Main Street.
By Molly Farrar September 23, 2025 | 5:39 PM 1 minute to read A body found behind a CVS in Wareham has been identified as a Middleborough woman, officials said.
Amy Nadolny, 41, was found in a wooded area along train tracks behind the CVS at 419 Main St.

title: Trump links Tylenol use in pregnancy to autism. Local experts urge caution.

title: Boston Healthcare for the Homeless Program laying off 25 in anticipation of Medicaid cuts
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News Healthcare workers planned to rally before BHCHP’s headquarters in Boston’s South End.

Tachick, a nurse with the Boston Health Care for the Homeless Program, left kneeling, and Jim Greene, Assistant Director for Street Homelessness Initiatives, Mayor’s Office of Housing, City of Boston, right standing, conduct welfare checks at the Temple Place MBTA Station in Boston.
Brett Phelps for The Boston Globe Facing looming Medicaid cuts, the Boston Health Care for the Homeless Program is laying off staff and shutting down a medical respite facility in Jamaica Plain.
